title: Drivel
review: There is a bleak hedge scene in this movie. It's an old English Yew. All I can say it's much more interesting and fast moving than this movie. Plot is utter nonsense. Scenes that don't tie up with what's subsequently said and done. Low budget drivel.

title: Micro budget
review: Why didn't they get any actors? Or a sound engineer? Come to think of it a script writer.

title: The Pits
review:
Watch first 2 minutes, 2 in the middle and skip to the end. You will save yourself an hour or so and a vacuous script. Actually the acting was so bad it made the script look better.
This is a plot formula which has been used on numerous occasions. The director had a dream, no not Martin Luther King's, no he thought he was Hitchcock. He isn't.
There are reviews disparaging others' views. Surely comments should be about films seen and not other reviewers comments?
